page.title: 06THE GOLDEN FLEECE PUB
page.content: Mr Bill Voce is considered to be one of the more important inhabitants of South Croxton. He is, of course, the landlord of the local public house, The Golden Fleece. Bill Voce was interviewed from the angle of "A day in the life of....". Bill took over the Golden Fleece two years ago. He has always found his customers very friendly and he thinks that South Croxton is a happy and friendly village. He actually owns the pub and so the Golden Fleece is a free house which means that it is not attached to just one brewery, though Bill buys most of the beer from Ruddles brewery. Originally the Golden Fleece building used to be a small cottage, a methodist hall and a blacksmith which have now been knocked into one. These buildings date back to 1750.
